summary: The European Stability Mechanism (ESM) is a pivotal financial institution established to safeguard the financial stability of the Eurozone. It operates under a legal framework designed to provide financial assistance to member states facing severe economic difficulties, thereby reinforcing monetary relations within the EU. The ESM can issue bonds and provide loans, ensuring that member states have access to necessary liquidity while adhering to strict conditionality measures. This mechanism plays a crucial role in crisis management, promoting fiscal discipline and stability across the Eurozone, thereby contributing to the overall resilience of the European monetary system.
